code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:white male treasurer aged 40 yrs reports moderate increased urination, moderate thirst. Also complains of moderate elevated fasting blood glucose levels from time to time. drinks daily he admits to smoking 1 pack/day for the last 4 years o:Height 75 in, Weight 123 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 15, Skin = hyperpigmentation over axillary creases, appears in NAD, Extremities = no edema, no skin breakdown, 2 + dorsalis pedis pulses, Extremities = DTRs = 1+ throughout, decreased proprioception B/L, Heart = RRR, PMI not displaced, no murmurs, normal S1/S2, Eyes = yellowish white discoloration noted on the retina and microaneurysms a:Type 2 Diabetes p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed ACTOS - 30 mg daily, and ordered HbA1c.

td.content: s:pt presents with 7 weeks history of moderate urinary frequency. patient also reports moderate tingling of the feet, moderate foamy urine, Diabetes. patient is a male treasurer aged 42 ys. he has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes for last 2 years Patient is a moderate drinker o:Height 74 in, Weight 122 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 15, HbA1c HbA1c=9 %, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, age-appropriate speech, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OS:20/100, normal pupillary reflex a:Type 2 Diabetes p:administered glyburide - 5 mg daily, performed HbA1c, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
